project_summary.vision: To revolutionize neurofeedback by moving from localized frequency training to dynamic, network-wide brain modulation.
project_summary.problem_statement: Traditional neurofeedback is often static and ignores the complex, networked nature of brain communication, leading to slow learning curves and limited clinical efficacy.
project_summary.solution: Neurasynk utilizes Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) to create a 'smart' closed-loop system. It treats the brain as a dynamic graph, where an AI agent learns the most effective way to stimulate neural plasticity by adjusting feedback in real-time based on functional connectivity patterns.
project_summary.key_innovation: The integration of graph-theoretical brain metrics with a Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO) agent to automate personalized neural therapy.

workflow.description: High-density EEG streaming via Lab Streaming Layer (LSL) with sub-millisecond precision.
Artifact removal using optimized ICA and Riemannian manifold-based signal cleaning.
Calculation of functional connectivity (Phase Locking Value) and graph-theoretical metrics (Clustering Coefficient, Global Efficiency).
PPO-based agent analyzes the current brain state to determine optimal feedback parameters.
Dynamic modulation of visual/auditory stimuli in a closed-loop to reinforce target connectivity patterns.

drl_framework.state_space: High-dimensional connectivity matrices and graph metrics.
drl_framework.action_space: Continuous parameters for stimulus intensity, frequency, and difficulty.
drl_framework.reward_function: Calculated based on the delta between current connectivity and the target 'optimal' brain state.

neural: Strengthened functional connectivity in target hubs
Enhanced neural plasticity in the prefrontal cortex
behavioral: Improved scores in N-back and Stroop cognitive tasks
Reduced mental fatigue during sustained attention tasks
Long-term retention of neural optimization (transfer effects)
